alert.note: Alert for Haines Borough and Klukwan (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 09 at 11:42AM AKST until February 10 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: .Conditions have warmed with not as much snow for locations around Pelican and Hyder. The first band of snow moved through the area with 1 to 5 inches being reported and is now over the far northern inner channels. Another band of enhanced precipitation is currently over the central panhandle and is in the process of moving north. This area of enhanced precipitation will begin to affect the northern inner channels again later this afternoon with snow persisting overnight before the entire system moves to the east. The placement of this enhancement could affect amounts along with temperatures being near or just above freezing. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. * WHERE...Haines area, greatest amounts along the Chilkat Peninsula. * WHEN...From noon today to 6 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow has moved into the area with a few inches being reported so far. A stronger band of heavier snow will move into the area Thursday evening.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
